Issues.Title: collect watchers' effects and flush after watchers' update
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
Recently, I try to implement the vue version of `react-flip-toolkit`. But there is no suitable place to get the dom snapshots. Of course, I can use the hook `beforeUpdate`, but there are some problems for it. Because the flip context should cache the state for all its related doms' snapshots (the dom may be a portal, which isn't the descendant of the flip context), and currently the schedule strategy for updating watchers may make the snapshot not reliable.

For example, the flip context includes componentA and componentB, and componentB is neighbor of componentA. When componentA and componentB both need to update, the scheduler will update componentA's watcher, and then componentB's.
In componentA's `beforeUpdate` hook, we cache its dom's snapshot, then updating its view, .e.g, its height. Then in componentB's `beforeUpdate` hook, we cache a WRONG snapshot, because a layout reflow will be triggered by previous componentA's update, affecting componentB's bounding rect (and here an unnecessary layout reflow is triggered).

To handle this case, we can do something like React, which updates watchers without updating dom, but collects their side effects (dom updates), and until the all states are stable. Then trigger watchers' some api like `getSnapshotBeforeUpdate()`, and finally flush all side effects.


### What does the proposed API look like?
`getSnapshotBeforeUpdate()`, triggered after all watchers' updated, and before flushing all side effects (dom updates).

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "collect watchers' effects and flush after watchers' update" (#9908)

npm install

在created()的生命钩子中，我打印了“这个组件创建了”，然后再destroyed()的生命钩子中，我打印了“这个组件被销毁了”，然后同时访问并修改了data里的数据并打印，也访问了一个printHello的methods方法，

Issues.Title: Vue.extend subclass `version` property
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
Currently, the `Vue.extend` function returns a subclass and copies over many properties from the parent unto the subclass constructor.

```
//  vue/src/core/global-api/extend.js 
// allow further extension/mixin/plugin usage
Sub.extend = Super.extend
Sub.mixin = Super.mixin
Sub.use = Super.use
```

However, the `version` property is not copied over. Is there a reason for this? Or is the client expected to go up the class hierarchy using the `super` property in order to get the version of the root Vue constructor?

### What does the proposed API look like?
 Sub.version = Super.version

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Issues.Title: 2.6-csp branch to support inline-templates with CSP enabled
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
Using inline-templates when CSP is enabled is currently impossible due to new Function() being used in the compiler in the full build.
In all posts that I could find regarding this issue the runtime only build is suggested. However when you are working on a project where you cannot move all templates to render functions, or precompile to render functions, this is not possible.

To us inline-templates are a very important part of the "progressive framework" idea. This allows us to utilize the full power of Vue while not forcing  a refactor upon our entire backend to use API's when we want to upgrade Vue to v2 (even though they ideally should).

For Vue 1.28 there is a specific csp branch which utilises notevil. I want to do the same for Vue 2.6.
I will try to provide a working fork, although I could use some help on this (it's my first time working with the vue source code)

### What does the proposed API look like?
1 branch, v2.6.x-csp, will be made where ```new Function()``` will be replaced by ```notevil.Function()``` to safely eval expressions.
Just like v1.28-csp, notevil will be included in the codebase.

Currently I have found ```new Function()``` in src/compiler/to-function.js:15 38 and src/compiler/no-error.js:86 95 which have to be refactored to ```notevil.Function()``` calls.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "2.6-csp branch to support inline-templates with CSP enabled" (#9895)

Issues.Title: Documentation Needed: from slot capture pattern and compile components
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
First, I looked for a solution on how to do this on vue's forum, discord and stack overflow with no success, by which I mean there were people asking similar things but no definitive answer, especially for   Vue2

So I asked on https://stackoverflow.com/questions/55722231/vue2-replace-slot-contents-with-compiled-component-based-on-regex

In essence this is an extension of https://vuejs.org/v2/examples/ Markdown Editor. Using regex to replace with static or class based html tags is a solved problem. However, what about replacing with components

e.g. text in `[[ <text here> ]]` should be `<MyComponent :my-prop="<text here>"/>` 




### What does the proposed API look like?
Ideally it would be a component with a single slot.
It would take a list or object of regex patterns and components. 
The component would replace the patterns with the compiled components

```html
<apply-compiled-components>
here is some [[special text]] that should have all kinds of  <<unique>> components
<MyOtherComponent/> can be in here and any patterns found within should be updated
</apply-compiled-components>
```

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Issues.Title: Vue transition-group is waiting for browser tab to be selected, before executing
Issues.Body: ### Version 2.6.10 ### Reproduction link [https://jsfiddle.net/to3f51kc/](https://jsfiddle.net/to3f51kc/) ### Steps to reproduce 1. open a tab with Vue application with transition-group for dynamically generated content ( e.g. https://jsfiddle.net/to3f51kc/) 2. open another tab in a browser and wait for a minute. 3. switch back to the tab where Vue application was opened. ### What is expected? After switching back to the tab with the Vue app, the only animations executed are those that were triggered only after the browser pane was selected. ### What is actually happening? After switching back to the tab with the Vue app, some "leave transitions" that were triggered while different tab was active in the browser, get executed. --- A list is generated in a v-for loop. Wrapped around it is a transition-group like so: ``` {{ item }} ``` A transition ( in css) on element deletion and creation is set: ``` .list-enter-active, .list-leave-active { transition: all 0.5s; } .list-enter { background-color: green; } .list-leave-to { background-color: red; } ``` (Flash red before removing from the list. Flash green after inserting into the list) The problem is that, if another tab on the browser is selected, and update on a list is made, the transition waits for the tab where Vue is to be selected. And only then transition gets executed. The issue was noticed on: Google Chrome Version 73.0.3683.103 (Official Build) (64-bit) and Firefox Quantum 66.0.3 (64-bit) While the issue can be seen on both Firefox and Chrome, it's more noticeable on Chrome
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Vue transition-group is waiting for browser tab to be selected, before executing" (#9890)

### Version 2.6.10 ### Reproduction link [https://codepen.io/anon/pen/ZZvVWv](https://codepen.io/anon/pen/ZZvVWv) ### Steps to reproduce Create a component that contains a button or input sandwiched in between two other elements that are both conditionally rendered using v-if against the same piece of data: ```js new Vue({ el: '#app', template: `
Hello
World
`, data: { open: false } ) ``` Now click the input to try and focus it. ### What is expected? The two conditional elements appear, the input is focused. ### What is actually happening? The input is focused but immediately blurred, the component renders twice, and the conditional elements are hidden. It is impossible to actually focus the input. Issues.Title: Properly encode/decode the percentage character (% -> %25) across browser and upon initial navigation
Issues.Body:
Currently, the percentage character creates multiple issues and inconsistencies. This is partly due to: - the `%` is forbidden as part of the pathname in the URL per its spec (https://url.spec.whatwg.org/#path-state) if not escaped - IE allows it because it follows a different spec (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3986#section-2.4) In Vue router, we have multiple inconsistencies between asterisk path, param paths and regular path regarding escaping these characters and whether the navigation is initial or triggered by a push/router-link Given this set of routes in history mode ```js [ { path: '/foo/:p', component: Foo }, { path: '*', component: Other, }, ] ``` ## History mode / Chrome, IE 11,10 | `to` | route match | href produced in router-link | `$router` info after clicking | `$router` info on direct navigation | remarks | | ---------- | ----------- | ---------------------------- | ----------------------------- | ------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | | `/%7D` | `*` | `/%7D` | `/%7D` - `/}` | `/}` - `/}` | User should write `/}` as the link instead | | `/}` | `*` | `/%7D` | `/}` - `/}` | N/A (browser should encode it te be `/%7D`) | - | | `/%25` | `*` | `/%25` | `/%25` - `/%` | ERROR | Navigation should be possible. Should user also write `/%` to be consistent? | | `/%` | `*` | ERROR | N/A (not working) | N/A (not valid) | Or should they escape the percent themselves because it's the only special character | | `/foo/%7D` | `/foo/:p` | `/%7D` | `/%7D` - p = `}` | `/}` - p = `}` | User should write `/foo/}` | | `/foo/}` | `/foo/:p` | `/%7D` | `/}` - p = `}` | `/}` - p = `}` | | `/foo/%25` | `/foo/:p` | `/%25` | `/%25` - p = `%` | ERROR | Navigation should be possible | ## Hash mode / TODO ## Query / TODO --- Complete html file to test. Requires a `vue-router.js` file in the same folder `index.html` ```html Document 
{{ $route.path }}
{{ $route.params }}
/home /%7D /} /%25 /foo/%7D /foo/} /foo/%25
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Properly encode/decode the percentage character (% -> %25) across browser and upon initial navigation" (#2725)

Issues.Title: Make START (as defined in /src/util/route.js) accessible through the public API
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
It makes it possible to compare the latest route to START. Now you have to manually compare to ensure it's the same (or access START through the source, which I'd rather not).

Why do I want to compare with START? To check if this is the first routing made. Why would I want to do that? If coming from server-side and auth check fail, I want to replace the current route (START) with the login one, since the browser has already made an entry to the history stack (if I push you can side step the auth guard and actually access the content by pressing the back button). If not the first one (and routing client side) I want to "push" the user into the login view, so that the previous history entry is intact.

### What does the proposed API look like?
I'm open for any way of accessing START properly, for example router.START

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

### Steps to reproduce

Do something that uses router.push or router.go inside of `mounted()` of the componentApp without a path or name.
For example, `router.push({query: { test: 'foo' }})`

vue-router is using /

Issues.Title: Strange behavior @click.stop
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.0.3

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/rmy08k3u/1/](https://jsfiddle.net/rmy08k3u/1/)







### Steps to reproduce
Good day.

Faced a problem, can anyone be able to help.

When placing a block in the router-link with the attribute @click.prevent.stop, clicking on the block does not make the transition. But placed in the input-checkbox block does not work.

When placing a block in the router-link with the @click.stop attribute, clicking on the block makes the transition. And located in the input-checkbox block, it works.

### What is expected?
When placing a block in a router-link with the @click.stop attribute, a click on the block should not make a transition, and placed in the input-checkbox block should work.

### What is actually happening?
When placing a block in the router-link with the @click.stop attribute, clicking on the block makes the transition. And located in the input-checkbox block, it works.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Strange behavior @click.stop" (#2702)

Issues.Title: Unused callback parameter in registerAction method causing trouble when testing mapActions
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.0.1

### Reproduction link
[https://github.com/vuejs/vuex/blob/4c0d0ae0abcd48f1df2c0c263402a94a214168b2/src/store.js#L434](https://github.com/vuejs/vuex/blob/4c0d0ae0abcd48f1df2c0c263402a94a214168b2/src/store.js#L434)







### Steps to reproduce
1. Create a component with method using mapActions
2. Test call of the method
3. Notice that the store action is called with 3 parameters: the store, the payload, and a unused callback always set to undefined.

### What is expected?
The action must be called with only the 2 first parameters.

### What is actually happening?
The action is called with a third parameters (cb) set to undefined.

---
I think this is an error. I don't see where it can be used.
I did not do a JSFiddle but linked you directly to the line where the potentially unused callback is.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Unused callback parameter in registerAction method causing trouble when testing mapActions" (#1526)

Issues.Title: Unit tests do not run when importing router into store and store into router
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.1.0

### Reproduction link
[https://github.com/djam90/vuex-vue-router-issue](https://github.com/djam90/vuex-vue-router-issue)







### Steps to reproduce
Run `npm run test:unit` and see the failure. To get the tests to run again, do not import the store into the router and the router into the store.

### What is expected?
The tests should run fine and circular imports should work. They *DO* work in the browser just not in Mocha testing environment. 

### What is actually happening?
Error as follows:

```
TypeError: Cannot read property 'getters' of undefined
    at /home/dan/code/vuex-router-issue/dist/webpack:/node_modules/vuex/dist/vuex.esm.js:261:1
    at Array.forEach (<anonymous>)
    at assertRawModule (/home/dan/code/vuex-router-issue/dist/webpack:/node_modules/vuex/dist/vuex.esm.js:260:1)
    at ModuleCollection.register (/home/dan/code/vuex-router-issue/dist/webpack:/node_modules/vuex/dist/vuex.esm.js:186:1)
    at /home/dan/code/vuex-router-issue/dist/webpack:/node_modules/vuex/dist/vuex.esm.js:200:1
    at /home/dan/code/vuex-router-issue/dist/webpack:/node_modules/vuex/dist/vuex.esm.js:75:1
    at Array.forEach (<anonymous>)
    at forEachValue (/home/dan/code/vuex-router-issue/dist/webpack:/node_modules/vuex/dist/vuex.esm.js:75:1)
    at ModuleCollection.register (/home/dan/code/vuex-router-issue/dist/webpack:/node_modules/vuex/dist/vuex.esm.js:199:1)
    at new ModuleCollection (/home/dan/code/vuex-router-issue/dist/webpack:/node_modules/vuex/dist/vuex.esm.js:160:1)
    at new Store (/home/dan/code/vuex-router-issue/dist/webpack:/node_modules/vuex/dist/vuex.esm.js:311:1)
```

---
My VueX store needs to be able to import the router so it can do routing things like navigate to another page.
My router needs to be able to access state from VueX to determine what to do in a `router.beforeEach` handler.

I have asked for help on Stack Overflow:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/54691789/unable-to-import-vuex-store-into-router-and-router-into-store-in-mocha-tests

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Unit tests do not run when importing router into store and store into router" (#1509)
